text: Slightly veiled dark amber color with moderate activity. Soft creamy beige 2 finger head, lasting around 5-10 minutes, with dense lacing but faint legs. Flavors of caramel, nutmeg, ginger, roasted grains, lemon, yeast, herbal spices. Bread and toffee sugary feel, with sharp zesty fruity that balance things out. Slick milky medium body with crispy and prickly carbonation. Medium strength finish, quite long, deeply malty and roasted, pleasant burnt caramel, with lingering leafy and citrusy hops. Interesting creamy density (a trademark for La vache folle?), still nicely fresh, with some sharp yeast. Quite tasty and filling, but uplifting like a Belgian. Overall very good quality craft. A robust ESB, heavily spiced and probably too much, not as delicate and pleasant compared to the Fullers.

Bottle. Clear copper body, small to medium beige head with good retention and lots of lacing. Classy aroma of roasted nuts, caramel, flowers, bread and cheese. Taste of caramel malt, herbs, bread and some citrus notes. A tad oily, flat and chewy. Excellent.

En fût au Café Cognac de Trois-Rivieres. Robe dorée claire sans col de mousse. Arômes de céréales, fromage, herbes. En bouche, céréales, orange, levures, zeste de pamplemousse. Texture légère et corps mince.
bottle. Amber-brown colour with light head. Fruity malts and flowery hops. Could have gone for a bit more bread character in the malts, but otherwise a really nice ESB.
From lacasadelacerveza. In Ikeas pint glass. After dinner. More refreshing than usual in the style, maybe thanks to a slight and pleasant sourness. Left me wanting more
500ml bottle. Floral hop aroma. Cloudy bronze in colour with a frothy off-white head. Grapefruit bitterness, bread and hints of spice. Smooth body. Very drinkable ESB.

500 ml bottle. Amber pour, generous rocky off-white head, leaves a few lace spots and a thin film. Aroma of caramel, bread, flowery / earthy hops. Taste is dry, fairly strong bitter finish, earthy hops and a slight lingering spice. Wish there was more malt presence in the mouth. Medium to heavier body, low carbonation. Good brew, breaks up the parade of IPA, bit seemed too bitter.
On tap at BBF. Amber colour with white head. Hoppy and malt aroma. Bitter, hoppy and fruity taste. Medium body.

On tap @ Barcelona Beer Festival 16 - Spain. Color: golden blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: grassy and floral. Bitterness from hops. Taste: light body with good malt taste balanced with grassy hops. Good attenuation and really drinkable. Aftertaste: superb bitterness not so fruity. Typical ESB.

Bouteille. Nez de houblon légèrement citrique (pamplemousse) et aux notes florales et résineuses, légèrement malté de caramel doux avec des notes épicées (coriandre, anis) et fruitées (agrumes, notes de pommes et de fruits tropicaux). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas et une texture légèrement crémeuse aux notes huileuses. Goût moyennement amer de houblon résineux doux, légèrement floral et herbeux et aux notes citriques (pamplemousse) et terreuses (qui dure toute la gorgée) avec un léger goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes de fruits tropicaux, faibles traces de pommes) et dépices (anis, coriandre) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût malté de caramel doux (notes de miel) avec des notes de malt pâle (biscuits et céréales) et de pain puis en finale, le goût amer de houblon reprend le dessus en étant légèrement plus herbeux, plus terreux et un peu sec. Arrière-goût moyen-long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon (herbeux, terreux, notes citriques, florales et résineuses) avec un léger goût fruité (zeste dagrumes, notes de pelures de pommes). [notes 2006]
Bottle into pint glass. Pours a slightly hazy copper colour with white head. Aroma is bready malt. Taste is flowery hops and bready malt.

From a bottle to a pint glass. Pours a clear caramel/orange color with a thin white head. Smell is sweet malt and bread with a nice floral hops scent. Taste is malty goodness with an excellent bitterness from the hops. Good balance. Finish is dry and bitter. Good stuff!

Bottle 50cl, a cloudy amber beer with good head. Nose is low, aroma is on sweet malt, candy touch, lot of yeast, caramel, grassy hops, light berries notes, grapefruit aftertaste, bit too yeast like, not very in the style.
Dark orange colour, white head, aroma of oranges, caramel, peach and malts. Taste is light bitter, slightly sweet and slightly sour. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation.

On tap at the brewpub. 
Rich sweet maltiness, light earthy hops, nice rich ESB

Pours very slightly hazy pale amber with two fingers of rocky light tan head, excellent retention and lacing. (4/5) Nose is caramel malt, bready yeast, mild floral. (7/10) Taste is mild sweet, moderate bitter. (7/10) Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, fairly quick bitter finish. (4/5)

Charlevoix are a solid brewery who produce consistently excellent beers. And as the style goes, this is a pretty good ESB. The problem is, even a pretty good ESB is fairly pedestrian fare. A little variation on the theme would have been welcome - maybe a little dry hopping to produce a more floral nose, for example? Dont get me wrong, I could easily session this, and Id like to try it on tap - but its not as much fun as the rest of their brews are. (15/20)

Pours a clear amber with a medium-high white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of cereals, caramel and floral, earthy hops. Slight nuts also. Taste is pretty dry, I at least cannot feel any sweetness. Light to medium bitterness (I remember it being unbareably bitter when I first started drinking craft beer, lol). Flavors are of cereals again and a little husky. Body is light and carbonation somewhat high. Overall a nice ESB, a style I dont drink/brew often enough (that or maybe the simple bitter, too).

500Ml Bottle. poors a clear amber orange color, very thick sustained head . smell is quite floral with some kind of spices. also have that iron smell to it. quite shy to tell you the truth a bit bitter in the after taste and a bit of floral sweetness to it. to tell you the truth I expected more comming from this brewery.... still not bad and achieves to make me want to drink it all, but its most likely that Im not going to buy it again

Pour is light caramel with a finger of foamy cap and great lacing. Nose is bread/yeast, caramel and floral hops. Taste is a nice sweet, bready malt with a lingering bitter finish. Despite the typo this stuff is exactly as advertised.

Clear amber with tan head. Nice aroma of grilled bread, caramel, honey, malt sweetness. Nice floral hops in the mix. Taste is mostly on the sweet side with a nice bitterness in the finish. Light body with a nice carbonation.

Bottle. Pours crystal clear orange with a small off-white head that dissipates quickly with some lacing. Aroma is corny(!), caramel, grass. Flavor is medium sweet, corny, caramel, malty, grass and a floral hint. Minimal bitterness. Medium light body, light bitter finish.

Appearance: Pours a light copper colour with a thin white head (about one finger) that dissipates quickly.

Smell: Yeast, dough, malt

Taste: Malt, yeast, hint of citrus and caramel on the finish

Overall: This beer had all of the bread/yeast characteristics and lots of malt that I expect from an ESB. It also had an interesting finish with a bit of citrus and caramel that lasted only a few seconds. Overall, a very good ESB.

Pours a very hazy copper with an average sized white head that leaves massive lace. Aroma is floral, toast, mild citrus and caramel maltiness. Flavour is floral, fruity, mild bitterness, mild citrus, caramel and toast. Tasty and session-able beer.

"Blonde yellowish appearance with a thick, creamy head, maybe a bit much. Has some floral and citrus aromes. Hops are nice and strong. Lacing appears thick, and lots. Mouthfeel is milky, a bit of bitterness and some malts. Smooth going down. Pretty refreshing."

Olfactif: Des accents floraux ainsi que des notes de petits bonbons et de caramel. Un nez pas très puissant, mais doux et raffiné.
Visuel: Ambrée, claire, avec une belle mousse rocailleuse, de bonne persistance, mais qui présente des difficultés à saccrocher aux parois du verre. 
Gustatif: Lattaque présente des notes de poivre, enrobé de caramel doux, avec une finale en douce amertume florale et terreuse, qui persiste en longue trainée sèche sur larrière de la langue. De petites fleurs aux accents de rose et de petites notes de jujube et de toffee constituent la palette des flaveurs avec des accents de terre en finale. Dun équilibre parfait et dune texture bien soyeuse, cette ESB tire son charme de la douceur de ses accents et de son équilibre des saveurs.

Pours cloudy amber and frothy head. Aroma of wheat and grains. Taste is grainy, barley, slightly sweet. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating #802 . Pours a dark amber with a foamy off-white head that dissipates slowly, medium-strong retention. Aroma is mild toasted malt, hints of wildflowers. Hop presence is significant, giving the bitter character, but the breadiness of the malt is what makes this beer. Creamy mouthfeel Well balanced, medium bodied ale that is easy to drink. Cheers.

Bière cuivrée-orangée, légèrement voilée, qui mousse avec modération. Le nez laisse poindre un peu de caramel et  le temps dun court instant  de houblon. En bouche, une douce danse mi-sucrée mi-amère sétale de la langue au palais. Le dosage et léquilibre de cette bière sont ses deux plus grandes qualités elles suffisent amplement à rendre ce produit exemplaire.

Cuivrée et voilée, avec un petit collet de mousse de couleur crème. Nez de malt et de caramel. Goût herbeux, floral et de malt. Lamertume est plutôt présente tout au long, mais se fait surtout sentir à la fin.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Dune belle robe dorée et légèrement orangée, cette ESB présente des arômes engageants de malt, de caramel et de camomille. On oublie presque lon tient un verre de Bitter. Rien pour retrouver le droit chemin, lamertume typique de ce style de bière nest pas très tranchante, le malt et le caramel quon retrouve au nez reprenant leur besogne, ce qui est un peu dommage. Pas mauvaise pour autant, mais rien pour écrire à sa mère.

500ml bottle. Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma of herbal and citrusy hops, brown sugar with a hint of toasted malts. Taste is caramel, toffee and biscuity malts, a bit too sweet. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, light bitterness finish.
bouteille 500ml ambrée. très douce au nez et en bouche. arome léger de caramel et de houblon. en bouche le gout est peu persistant avec des notes dhibiscus. bière accessible

Orangé, légèrement voilée et coiffé dune mince couche de mousse beige qui sestompe rapidement, cette ESB offre un délicieux nez de houblons aromatiques supportés par une riche odeur de malt. En bouche, elle est légèrement crémeuse et offre une belle amertume toute en rondeur. Le nez est très représentatif du goût. Excellente bière très bien balancé et justement houblonnée.

Bière orangée cuivrée, parfaitement limpide, effervescence modérée, surmontée dun col un peu beige, mousseux rocailleux, un peu mince mais résistant et qui laisse une jolie dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes sucrés bien malté, sucre dorge, caramel et mélasse. En bouche, un peu pétillant, un peu mousseux, avec une belle onctuosité au palais. Au goût, on retrouve le malté sucré (sucre dorge surtout), et cest suivi dun agréable houblon floral menant à une finale à lamertume plutôt légère. Un certain goût alcoolisé est perceptible. Une bonne bière, sans plus!

rousse aux arômes de caramel et houblon,fleural.en bouche caramel et une finale amêre de houblon.Jai combiné sa avec un fromage à tartiné de chèvre,lâcreté du fromage avec lamertume du houblon sannule pour manifesté un goût de caramel écossais....sublime.

Very good for an ESB. Really a cut above the rest. Pours orange with good head and lacing. Hoppy malt nose. Finishes with lasting dose of bitterness and some woodiness as well. Nice beer for style. Bottle from Delires du Terroir.

Ambré. 
Très malté. Léger goût de sirop dérable. Fine amertume. Un peu floral. Légère effervescence. Bien représentative du style. Caramel. Bière de soif.

Mince col de mousse sur une liqueur cuivrée presque dorée. Mince. Au nez, elle a des relents de céréales, de sucres et de fruits jaunes. Elle rappelle vraiment une blonde aussi en bouche, mais avec du corps, une belle rondeur sucrée aux fruits, et une petite damertume finale, juste pour dire. Cest sans doute lune des bières les plus conventionnelles de Charlevoix, mais ça ne lui enlève pas ses qualités et ses mérites. Très agréable, mais convenue.

Belle couleur dorée, avec une mousse blanche généreuse. Bouquet de houblon, de parfums floraux (citron subtil). En bouche, lamertume est dabord très évidente. Cette rousse plutôt pâle nous amène des notes de zeste de citron, de pain, de houblon. Vraiment un bon petit produit qui amène une finale amère à souhait. Jadore les étiquettes des produits «Vache folle», de cette microbrasserie qui est lune de mes favorites au Québec. Bon produit! Cheers!

500 ml bottle.  Pours a very light, clear amber with a massive head.  Aroma is subtle but brings fruit and mild floral scents.  Taste has a fairly assertive hop bitterness and very mild biscuit but not much else of interest.  Get a little bit of alcohol and the chalky grain flavors typically associated with lagers and pilsners.  Relatively thin, moderate carbonation and a fairly bitter lingering after-taste.

Outre létiquette, cette bière est le prolongement de la qualité de cette microbrasserie.  Équilibre somptueux entre le malt, la levure et le houblon...on croit prendre une London Pride ESB mais non, cest québécois.  Une excellente bière.

Bottle (500 ml). Clear orange/golden with a medium fully lasting creamy off-white head and solid lacing. Aroma is of malt, flower and fruits with a touch of sweetness. Taste is moderately sweet with malt, flower and slight bitter finish. Mouthfeel is slightly dry. Medium body. Extremely drinkable but not so complex and quite different from othe EBS Ive tasted so far. A  pretty enjoyable beer!

500ml bottle. Good colour and head on this one, but crystal clear. Taste and smell are a nice balance of bitter hops, malt, biscuit and a touch of fruit. Body was smooth and not to heavy or thin. Overall, a really enjoyable ESB.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours copper with ok beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of malt, flowers (honey). Taste is of malt, flowers (honey). Sligth bitterness, but well balanced with sugar. Easily drinkable. Good ESB!
Smooth hoppy flavor. Grassy, hops. Honey provides a sweetness to add balance. Golden pour with thick white head that laces the glass. Really good beer. 082012

Hoppy and refreshingly bitter with a lingering aftertaste of citrus and herbs at 40 IBU. Far from mundane! Great beer from a great Quebec micro!

Purchased in Wakefield, QC @ Depanneur Bonne-Heure

pours straw golden. large thin head which disperses quickly. Aroma is caramel and creamy with a hint of grassy hops. taste is incredibly smooth with caramel flavours with a mildly bitter after taste. very pleasant and thirst quenching. palate is medium to heavy bodied creamy with low carbonation. long lightly bitter finish. overall the one word i can use to describe this beer is creamy and delicious. big fan of this beer.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 Bouteille 500ml. Couleur orangée voilée, mousse beige. Arôme de malt grillé, herbacé. Goût de malt, houblon herbal, longue amertume, touche de caramel.
Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

@Mondial de la Bière 2012, Montreal - slightly hazy amber with a little foam left; fair hoppy aroma with notes of tea and apricots; a decent malt backbone; some astringency and a long dry bitter fruity hoppy finish - very nice

Pours a hazy orange with white head that is quick to dissipate.  Very little lacing.  Light floral/herb aroma, with a little bead/dough.  Taste is sweet with light hop notes.  I was expecting it to be more bitter, but still not shabby.

Verse une bière ambrée avec un mince col blanc. Nez houblonné et floral. En bouche, une certaine amertume mais qui effleure le palais uniquement. Houblon léger. Une bonne bière mais qui reste au premier niveau par manque de complexité et dintensité.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2012 pours a nice slightly hazy bright orange with a very nice off-white head, very good retention and lacing. bready and toasted malts, biscuity, citrus, floral, leafy. average carbonation - fizzy, medium to full body, very nice medium long grapefruity finish.
Bottle, nice offering, I found it light on the english bitterness, it was pretty smooth flavoured and it was enjoyable
This was an excellently balanced ESB. More on the sweet side than bitter, but theres a nice balance of both flavours. Solid beer,

Pours clear and copper with a thin white head. Aroma is nice and floral yet a little sweet as well. Great flavour. This beer is great full and rich, floral and hopy. The bitterness is perfect. This is an excellent bitter.
Parfum de houblon. Robe ambrée surmonté dun colle blanc cassé. Goût de houblon floral et de caramel amère. Carbonatation moyenne. Très bonne ESB.

500 ml bottle, had it with salmon alfredo pasta. Pours a very pale, clear amber with a quickly disappearing white head. Subtle herbal smell. Tastes slightly fruity and spicy. Main taste Id say is sugarfree whipping cream. Impressive hoppy taste, very good level, just strong enough without being overly aggressive. Body is medium, mouthfeel is very creamy. Went great with my meal!

500ml bottle pours a pale amber color with a 2 finger white head that settles to some nice lacing.  Aroma is flowery hops with some earthy notes.  Taste is nicely balanced between the bitterness and lightly toasted malts.  This is a high quality bitter which is definitely worth a tasting.  Medium body and some nice carbonation leave a nice tingle on the palate.

An excellent bitter that meets the high usual standards of this brewery, one of Quebecs finest microbreweries. A lot of their beers tend towards the extremes of certain styles but not this one. Here they have brewed a fairly standard ESB but nontheless a standard ESB of very high quality. Very well balanced maltiness with a subtle but nevertheless fairly present bitterness. I have the impression that this brewery has a very good water source which would not be surprising given its location in a small town in the countryside. One can taste that in addition to the brewers skill in balancing ingredients, the base of the beer is very good water, and ingredient often not given importance enough in beer reviews.

This beer pleasantly surprised me. It pours a nice off-white head with moderate foamy lacing. It is a nice clear, golden/amber color with a deceivingly sparkly look (it doesnt taste as carbonated as it looks). Aromas of hay and bread with a taste of grassy hops. Very little hops in the aroma. This beer has a medium bitter finish that doesnt permeate the overall taste of the beer for better or worse. Overall I enjoyed this beer.

Bottle from a generous trader. Pours clear amber with white head. Nose and taste of bready malt, sweet malt, caramel, toffee, flowers and hint of lemon zest. Finishes slightly bitter.  Medium body. Solid beer.

High malty aroma with spicy notes and a bit of yeast off-flavor. Light crystal orange color with persistent off-white color. High malty flavor with some oak hints and a bitter side that reminds us Hops (ctrusy, green leaves). This is a good bitter, but malt is dominent over hop instead of being balanced with hops. Also it seams that us hops where used instead of UK Hops.

[bottle]
Cardboardy aroma thats a bit creamy and with spicy, European hops. Clear gold with a thick, off-white cover. Slightly astringent but nice bitterness and some pleasant fruity notes. Toffee/caramel at the end. Crisp and moderate bitterness, light body.

500mL bottle from a sampler pack of La Vache Folle.  Pours clear golden yellow.  Aroma is mostly malt with a hint of hops.  Caramel malt taste with a clean bitter finish.  Nice one - possibly the best ESB Ive had.

500 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits.  Pours a virtually clear orange with good-sized slightly off-white head.  Aroma is caramel and some light floral/citric hops.  Flavour has caramel malt and floral hops with a touch of lemon zest.  Modestly bitter finish.  Nice.

No head or carbonation to speak of. Pleasantly hoppy but slightly watery body. Almost the consistency of cask beer but underwhelming in flavor in that regard. Slightly fruity and caramel alcohol notes.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2014 Couleur miel, elle dégage une odeur de caramel écossais (toffee) et dun houblon, assez subtil, qui se cache derrière des arômes dherbes et dalcool. Elle est un peu sucrée; le caramel y est toujours présent, ainsi que le houblon qui nous laisse une belle amertume en bouche qui dure assez longtemps, avec des pointes modérément alcoolisées. Très bonne bière. Pratiquement 2 ans et demi plus tard, cest pratiquement le même constat. Un côté minéral et presque croustillant me semble compléter le tableau (RR-280214)
Bottle; hazy copper with medium tan head; aroma-sweet caramel, floral, roasty; taste-light sweetness, medium bitterness, almost no carbonation. Very decent beer.

Pours a hazy golden orange/red with a two inch thick white head. Smell is very fruity and floral: citrus, orange, 

lemon, caramel, strong tea, Taste is very sweet and zesty, orange, heavy grapefruit, lemon, tropical fruit, grassy hops, malt. A very nice bitterness rides undearneath it all. Lemon peel and bitter hops leave a long, beautiful finish. Perfect carbonation, and a watery, dry mouthfeel. A delicious beer, perfect for a hot summer day.

Pours a hazy copper with thinnish, but lingering ivory head.  Hoppy aroma - floral notes, plus some citrus and tropical fruit.  Could use a bit of a stiffer malt backbone - the caramel malt sneaks in a bit on the finish (or it might show up more if it was warmer).  Potent bitterness from start to lingering finish.  Crisp and extremely drinkable.
Amber ale with a good collar. Hop, candy and vegetal aromas. Perfect balance between hop and candy taste.

Bière presque limpide couleur de miel coiffée dun col minimal beige.  Des arômes lactés de caramel, de résine et de conifères.  Intensément amère.  Effervescence moyenne à la texture collante.  Offre une longue fin amère et arômatique.
Dark orange pour with small white head. Slight hoppy aroma. Taste is slightly bitter hops. Carbonation is perfect with everything balancing out very nicely. Surprised at how good this beer is.

Bottle.  Pours an amber toned body with an off white head.  Floral and herbal hop tones atop nice nutty bruin notes.  A nice soft floral hop tone, mild caramel sweetness creamy body and light bitterness.  A darn good ESB.

Bottle from Firefly, VancouverBeautiful copper color; medium sized head. Mild aroma of caramel, fudge, milk. Good body strength; caramel flavor, with malt, and a good earthy character, harsh in the good way, but also some delicate aromatic hopping. Very balanced and well brewed.

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy amber with a large off-white permanent bubbly head. Delicate sweet aroma, bread, some hops but muted. Sweet and bitter on the palate, tangy like orange zest, some yeast as it fates into a nice bitter finish, then mellows but keeps on going - unexpected but very nice.
Bottle @ Hosers. Pours medium amber, 1-finger persistent head. Nose caramel, spicy hops, very lifted. Flavours are spicy caramel, some raunch, very flavorful. A solid bitter.

Bière rousse forte de 6 % dalcool. Elle possède un léger goût floral, légèrement agrémenté dagrumes, un peu sucré et en même temps fruité. Intéressante et rafraîchissante. Sapparente à une bière blanche dété.

Bottle. Pours dark orange/amber with a nice white head. Heavy lacing at first, moderate toward the end. Aromas full of caramel, bread, nuts and dairy. Taste is similar. Lots of malt and caramel. Nice little bitter finish. I would have liked more hop presence at the end.

Pour see through orange with thin short lived white head. Aroma bread, sulfur, sweetness, and malt. Taste nice malt backbone, overripe tangerine, biscuit, sweetness, caramel and English hops. MF was medium with a crisp feel. Overall decent beer.
Hoppy flowery aroma with hings of ginger. Amber colour, a bit hazy. Medium sweet tast, and medium bitterness. Overall very good bitter from an always exciting PQ brewer.

500 ml bottle. Amber color with thin white head. Sweet hoppy taste, caramel, yeast.  Not so bitter. Grassy feeling in mouth. Short finish. This must be a bad bottle. I really wanted to love this one but I really couldnt. Im gonna try it again and re-rate if the feeling is different.

500 ml bottle.  Pours slightly hazy amber in colour, with small off white head.  Aroma and taste are nice biscuity malt, and some slightyly earth english hops.  Seems a really good example of the style.

Pours a clear light amber colour with a foamy white head. Aroma is of floral hops with some grain malts present as well. The taste is mild with a reasonable dry bitterness to it. Medium body, average carbonation and somewhat thicker on the palate. Overall a very nice ESB.

Lovely clear copper colour with a frothy white head. Caramel aroma with hint of hop. Smooth rich flavour of toffee, nice hop bitterness. Nothing to impress but a rather solid beer. Not overly hopped, which is what an ESB should be like. Nice beer. Love the label.

500ml bottle. pour with good carbonation and posseses a nice red tinge to the otherwise amber looking clear ale. aromas are grain and cereal, with a little biscuit note,  it also has a nice floral hoppy aroma and some roasted malt notes as well. the palate is creamy, rich and well layered but not overly flavourful. Notes include slight bittering roasted note and again that nutty character. this is a great stylish brew!

500ml bottle courtesy of McBerko. Amber, yellow head. Enticing aroma of caramel malt. Strongly malty taste, faint peppermint and pine needles. Crisp, well-balanced finish. Excellent beer for a style Im usually so-so on.

500mL bottle, pours cloudy golden orange with a white head. Aroma is extremely fruity - apricot, peaches, and some floral hops. Flavour reveals more of the bitterness, and not as much of the fruitiness as the nose suggests. Very enjoyable.

Pours dark golden, perfect 1cm head (it started huge, though). Aroma is certainly weaker than expected -- grassy and floral hops, some malt, slight mud, but this is far from overpowering aroma. Taste is grassy, even earthy hops early on, with citurs hops, caramel and cereal kicking in later on, and the finale is pretty much all hops (but somewhat subtile). Watery/oily mouthfeel, and extremely crisp overall. This is a medium-body ESB with some serious everyday beer potential. Those guys are GREAT brewers!

Pours a very deep golden color with a very tall, frothy, dense white head that really remains full for the entire tasting. Aroma has a sweet, hoppy profile with modest notes of floral hop bitterness with a strong accentuating toffee note. Flavor has an early modest grassy hops note but a moderate/strong toffee note kicks in soon after with a mild alcohol and generic hop bitterness at the end. Brew has a very crisp feeling but leans a tad bit to the watery side in texture. Overall a very solid brew. The head on this thing is monstrous!

500 mL bottle from Dépanneur Simon Anthony in Montreal, served in an English pint. Pours clear amber with a frothy tan head. The head fades relatively quickly but leaves a good amount of fine lace. The nose is caramel, toasted malt, flowers, citrus and earth. The flavour begins moderately sweet but quickly develops a moderate bitterness which remains to the end. It is very well balanced overall. The finish is moderate in length and hoppy. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a pretty good ESB. The aroma is slight and a little disappointing, but it improves after that. The malts are nicely roasted and well balanced with very nice hops. 2010-09-10

Bottle via my brother-in-law.  Pours a very nice copper w.a  great pillow head.  Nose is wonderful toffee, maltiness, some dark fruits.  Maybe a tiny bit oxidized but Im fine with it.  Flavor is caramel, toffee, great grassy English hop, some distinctive English yeast character.  Very pleasant bitterness comes out in the malty finish.

500ml brown bottle. Orange-amber in colour with a small creamy, whitish cap. Modest lacing on the glass. Beer has a slight haze. Nose has a dash of floral notes, some citrus, some malt. Good malt character, good richness, maybe a bit nutty. Very pleasing late citrus bitterness. Medium body with mild carbonation, overall a solid ESB.

500ml bottle. Seaport Beer Festival. Pours deep amber with eggshell head. Almost completely non-existent on the nose, which makes the taste a real punch. Its bold and punchy with a good long bitter finish.

Presque la perfection du style. Je ne crois pas quon puisse sy approcher davantage!

Un must à déguster.
Écoeurante!!! Très bien houblonné, bon goût et saveur délicieuse. Rafaichissante et pétillante!

Dark gold with tinge of red, lacy white head. Good malty and grain aromas that are generally sweet. Taste follows aroma pretty well, with a gentle sweetness and just a little hop to brace the palate. Very easy drinker, well done.
10.07.21 hazy orange low carb A:caramel, candy, citrusy. F:Med body finish is bitter and medium long. O:Well made the maltiness and hoping of that beer are very interesting.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2011 Bouteille 500 ml. 6%. Couleur ambrée légèrement orange. Mousse blanche. Nez sucré et complexe. Douce en bouche, gout léger de caramel, dérable et de malt. Légèrement fruitée. Finale en amertume. Très bonne bière.. Excellente qualité.

Pours a light amber color, earthy hops and caramel nose shine in the nose, but are not over powering. Mouth is a bit chewy, lots of caramel and hops balancing each other out. Good balance. Moderately bitter finish. Good example of the style.

Purchased at Dépanneur de la Rive in Cap-Rouge, Quebec in September 2005. Pours a cloudy amber-beige colour with a big fat off-white creamy head. The retention is very heavy and long with big chunky foam lacing. Hoppy, earthy and floral notes for the aroma. Smooth mouthfeel and medium-bodied. The taste is a good mix of caramel malt with a good punch in the mouth, from the hop. Not crazy bitter, but great taste of hop for sure. Great brew for hop lovers !
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange amber with a creamy golden head. Aroma is sponge toffee and caramel apples. Flavour is chiefly toffee with light nutty and fruity accents. Finishes medium bitterness.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours amber with a thin white head and nice lacing.  aroma is fruit, hops and yeast.  Medium body.  Taste is tart but not too bitter with some almost sour fruit.  dry finish.  The belgian yeast in an ESB is not a taste Ive encountered before.

So good. Pour is copper amber body with a bountiful white head. Aroma is pears, apple, hops, and light toffee malts. Taste is sweet, smooth, creamy and slightly hoppy. Very well crafted and nice combination of flavours.

Bière rousse chapeautée dune mousse blanche qui laisse beaucoup de traces.  Présence de houblons floraux, de malt doux, de caramel et peut-être de noix.  Au goût, saveurs de houblons citriques et résineux, grains maltés.  Le corps est moyennement constitué et la texture du liquide assez crémeuse.  Le liquide offre en finale une longue persistance de lamertume.

Slightly hazy orange with a nice thick, velvety off white cap with messy, slippery lacing. Has a mild, fresh aroma made up of light fruit, caramel... its quite mild. Green apples? What the? Mild taste, nice fruity bitterness, hard leafy bitterness.. I like I think. Something is wrong here.. is it the bottle or am I catching a cold? Another bottle to be purchased a second time now that its available locally. RE-REVIEW.

ESBs may not be in vogue these days, but a well built bitter is unlike anything else. A nice nutty brownish amber pour with thick off-white, lasting head caps a wold of bitter sweet aromas a touch of herbal hops and caramelly sweetness. La Folle ESB is both creamy and resinous; everything fans of the style could hope for. In a land where hops dont abound as they do here, the creative brewers at Charlevoix. Artist Denis Reid is the man behind this brewerys spectacular labels.

Bottle. Nice nutty brown pour with thick off white head that lasts a while. Good bitter sweet aromas a good mix of herbal hops and caramel sweetness some fruits kind of peary. Taste is overall pretty bland, same slight hop and caramel taste. Decently creamy mouthfeel.

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée chez Marché Chamard (Répentigny, QC). Arôme: Odeur dhoublons et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pamplemousse et de caramel avec une pointe de pins. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #2751)

Bottled, thanks Timo A and hanniku! Hazy amber color with fluffy head. Spicy, perfumed, rubbery, yeasty and berryish aroma. Dryish, berryish, caramelly and yeasty flavor with phenols, yeasty bitterness. Tastes yeasty and stale.

500 ml bottle from Marche Jovi- A nice looking hazed amber, with a giant frothy cap that laces pretty well. The aroma is predominantly yeast and earthy grains with a touch of floral hops, but I cant really get much else out of it because it smells like a fucking yeast factory. Tastes sweet, a bit of caramel, floral hops, grainy, and then comes the yeast attack that overwhelms everything else. This is a yeast funk bomb of an ESB. This would be even too yeasty for a lot of Belgian ales. Sour, yeasty, grainy finish is unappealing. I think I see what is going on here. This must be the brewerys idea of some sort of early April Fools joke.

500 mL bottle.  Pours copper-brown with a lovely white head.  Mild aroma of caramel and bread.  Flavour is dominated by caramel sweetness, but it is not overbearing.  Some toast and nuts in there from the malt as well.  Some pineapple hops add a little flavour, and some bitterness to the finish.  Medium body.  Carbonation is solid.  Very drinkable.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. The smell is musty, fruits, funk, sweet, and hops.  The look is clear, golden to orange in color, with a whitish head.  The taste is watery, weird, grains, floral, and hops.
A very pleasant beer, poured a dark amber with a bountiful head fruity esters were apparent with a tingling of bitterness in the finish.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Gold in color with a decent sized off-white head. Aroma is of grain and honey. Taste is of light hops and grain.
Pours deep amber into a snifter. Fluffy off-white head with excellent retention.  Mild resin upfront with a crips well-balanced caramel and hops in the middle. Dry lasting resin finish.
Aroma of floral and hop.  Taste is a bitter caramel and hop.  Its an above average bitter.  Nothing terribly noteworthy but better than most.
(500ml bottle)  Pours a clear copper body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of caramel, citrus, and florals.  Flavor of caramel, bread, and hops (grass, earth, florals) with a dry, bitter finish.

Beautiful looking brew, peachy copper body thick crown and lovely roapy lacing. Aroma is granny smith apple, roasted malt with a bitter twinge, and some faint hops the whole thing comes across to mild. Watery malt flavour, sweet hard candy and a hidden sour apple makes brief appearances. Good beer to drink I guess has a unique flavour but nothing to special.
(500ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye) Pours orange with nice head and awesome lacing. Nice sweet and sour combo in the nose on this one, bitter up front that finishes bitter too which Im not liking.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured gold with a great white head and some lace.  aroma of caramel and citrus with flavor being lemon.  light body with no carbonation.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  light amber with an off white head.  nose is light grass with some caramel.  nice thickness with a smooth bitter flavor.

Bottle courtesy of bu11zeye.  Rusty gold color.  Smell of sweet and dry.  Hints of grain.  Very soft taste.  Nothing upfront but the sweet comes through on the finish.  Very bland for an ESB, but extremely assessable and smooth.
good copper pour with a frothy beige head. a good hoppy aroma with some nice caramel malts. A solid esb, but not amazing.

Clear copper with a huge frothy head with good retention. Aroma is caramel, ps, malt, and citrus. Flavor is a little drier than expected, roasted malt, caramel, hops, grapefruit and a hint of pine.Medium to  full body.

500ml bottle. Poured clear copper (hazy for the bottom part). Huge foamy head. Some retention. Aroma is hard for me to describe. Some caramel, some hops, bread. Taste is caramelish.Hints of fruits. Enjoyable beer, quite drinkable, well balanced. Really nice looking. THe head stayed quite a long time. The beer is getting more hoppy in aroma and taste as it wams up. It is still having a small head even 30 mins after pouring it. Rating #87

A good ESB, must be a pretty high IBU, very bitter, everlasting aftertaste all in hop bitterness that seems to come back again and again.  Citrus in the taste, grapefruit, notes of caramel.  A lot more serious beer than the tag could have one think.  Worth driving a few miles to get it...  Premium quality brew, as for most of this brewers products.
Orange- rusty color. Nice fruity aroma. Wonderful palate. Complex malty taste with great bitterness. Not sure its a classic ESB but very, very good.

Bottle.  Pours with a huge, bubbly head, and a burnt orange body.  Huge amount of lacing.  Aroma is very soapy and herbal.  Flavor starts with dried fruit, pine, and flowers, never reaching sweetness.  Some back-palate mustiness makes things interesting.  Finishing notes have bitterness, ash, caramel, and more soap.  A sort of spiciness runs throughout.  Much of the carbonation is let out in the form of the head, making for an overly still body.  Kind of a strange drinker, but overall decent.

Acheté à la trappe à fromage en format de 500ml et dégusté dans un verre de guinness. Apparence orange ambré au reflet brumeux de levure en suspension et on fond du verre; une mousse collante et persistante. Arômes de caramel, levure, très houblonné, malt de blé et sarazin et une touche de citron. Goût dhoublon avec une touche de menthe, citron, pelure dorange avec une touche de caramel. Bonne amertume et corp avec une longue finale.

Ale ambrer tres claire. Fruiter et bien houblonner.

Amber ale, very clear. Fruity and weel hopped.

Brown bottle, 500 ml, drank in its glass, purchased at Le Grand Duc, savoured on November 10 2008; eye: polished copper that has started to tarnish, hazy, nice effervescence, creamy tan head that remains, nice lacing; nose: citrusy hops, grapefruit, light pine, malt; mouth: hops, light astringency, hops, malt, light pine, light spices, dry finale in grapefruit and a hint of caramel malt, grainy texture, medium body, mildly bitter, rather carbonated; overall: quite likable

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml, bue dans son verre, achetée chez Le Grand Duc, savourée le 10 novembre 2008; il : cuivre poli en train de ternir, voilée, bonne effervescence, mousse fauve crémeuse qui demeure, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon citrique, pamplemousse, léger pin, mal; bouche : houblon, légère astringence, houblon, malt, léger pin, léger épices, finale sèche en pamplemousse avec une pointe de malt caramel, texture granuleuse, corps moyen, moyennement amère, plutôt carbonatée; en résumé : bien aimé

Thanks to Dany for the bottle!  Poured clear, brighter golden with a towering, thick cap of white head.. thorough lacing as it descended.  The aroma was sweet with bready, lemon, and a pinch of honeysuckle notes.. perfume and dry spices accented.. well put together.  The flavor opened with sour lemon and almost oaky notes opening into a bready center.. floral bitterness around the middle, again picking up some spicy yeast.. finished sweet, but with a tangy and engaging bitterness that made it refreshing.  Medium-bodied with a thicker feel to it (especially the head that felt like whipped cream).. sweet, yet spicy and well-balanced.  Nice one!
TOP BITTER.  Cette bière est dans la classe mondiale.  Tres belle couleur ambré.  Bonne balance de sucré et d’ amertume.  Finale houblonné...GOUTEZ-Y!
Bottle courtesy of glouglouburp.  Pours copper with a generous white head.  Smells of perfume, pine resin, some citrus, spice.  Tastes earthy with a nice resiny aftertaste.  Very enjoyable.
Thanks Harry!!! - Cloudy red, orange colour with a large off white head. Sweet and sour candy floss aroma, some hints of tea and juniper (thanks Harry) with a lovely dry finish, super beer!

500 ml. brown bottle, 4,29$

Nice label,

A: nice copper color, a bit hazy in the last pour, nice head.
S: nice floral, spicy, caramel smell.
T: bitter taste, with a nice malt caracter.good bitter aftertaste
D: nice ESB, good balance, I like this beer

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2008 Bouteille brune de 500 ml. Arômes enjoués de houblon fruité. Belle robe rousse, très belle mousse. Il s’agit d’une bière très équilibrée, dans laquelle le malt, la levure et le houblon s’expriment. Arrière-goût amer de houblon.

Lightly cloudy copper / orange poor with a thick beige foamy head.  Aromas of honey, caramel, very hoppy, cirtous and fresh malt and yeast.  Medium body with a very nice hop presence that is long lasting.  Nicely carbonated.  Added flavors of caramel, orange zest.  Very good overall.

Bouteille 500 ml  . Couleur cuivrée. Mousse épaisse qui tient tout au long de la dégustation. Au nez des arômes de houblons floraux et de citron se font découvrir. En bouche le houblon est très présent et moyennement amère. Un léger goût de levure et de malt sont perceptibles.

Date: 07/02/2006
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, Cellar Party

hazy light amber, lightly hopped sweet malt aroma, dry carmel mat favor, nice earthy malt flavor, long bitter finish

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 2.9/5.0Drinkability: 7/10
Score: *4
Bouteille. Belle robe brun-cuivre, voilée, et quel col de mousse ! Arome épicé et de grain. Effervescence et corps moyen. Houblon bien présent avec finale caramélisée et alcoolisée.

Bottle courtesy of Hogtown harry.  Looks great - dark orange , some bubbles, orange tinted head.  Lovely aroma - orange citrus hops, earthy malt, fresh grain - lovely!  Classic ESB taste - lots of hops, earthy, tangy, great body to back it up.  So fresh and tasty, bang on style.  Excellent!

500 mL bottle from Montreal (Joanette).
App.:  golden-orange, hazy (oh yeah??) and a large light tan head. 
 
Aroma: light fruitiness, orange and citrus, yeasty, an acidity that isnt vinegar...more like malic (apples) and a sort of dank earthiness that I have trouble characterizing.  When warmed a bit, light grapefruit hops comes through.  

Palate:  med-full body, carbonation that starts soft and subtle but suddenly turns aggressive and sharp.  

Flav.:  immediately yeasty, very yeasty (hence the haze, I guess).  Moderate sweetness.  A bit of the orange citrus and fruitiness beyond that.  Decent bready-malty, toffee finish.  Again presents some citrus hops when warmed a bit.  Not too bitter.

This cant be right, but it isnt wrong either.  Closer to a hoppy Hefeweizen than an ESB.  An infection with a happy ending?  Is the cow crazy or am I??

Bottle via trade with HogTownHarry. Slightly cloudy amber with a large, foamy off-white head. Aroma is subdued, but nice - good sweet malt notes, a faint earthiness, and mellow herbal hops. Great mouthfeel, soft and pleasant. Nice flavour as well, following the aroma to a T. Good stuff!
Bonne rousse, sans arrière-goût. Pas âcre. Je la qualifierais dune bonne bière qui se prend toute en douceur, une bonne bière dans la moyenne.
Bonne rousse, sans arrière-goût.  Pas âcre.  Je la qualifierais dune bonne bière qui se prend toute en douceur, une bonne bière dans la moyenne.

500ml bottle acquired in trade with MartinT (thanks!). Initially poured a medium and clear orange color that turned deep and cloudy towards the bottom half of the bottle. Aromas of toasted malts, citrus, caramel and a little fruity. Tastes of toasted malts, light citrus and light caramel.
Light orange body.  Fruity nut nose.  Flavour was kool aid.  pretty watery.
Bottle. Cloudy amber with a ½ inch foamy head. Nose-nutty, musty. Taste-watery, fruit juice, thin, very light fruit, tastes overly thin. Reminds me of slightly bitter brown ale. Very husky.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2008 Cloudy golden orange with a large white head.  Original spicy/herbal aroma.  Taste is original and not typical ESB.  Cedar, coriander, weird hops, unknown spices,  some creamy caramel.  Not that different from the Dominus Ambrée (although I find the Ambrée far superior).  Once again like it is often the case with Charlevoix products Im pretty sure Ive had bottles that tasted different in the past.  Ill stick to the Dominus line of products from this great micro-brewery.  In this day of age to call Mad Cow (Vache Folle) a commercial product is the marketing equivalent to opening a Michael Jacksons Kindergarden.
Poured a hazy amber color with a small off-white head.  Light caramel and citrus fruit flavor.  The aroma was light with notes of caramel and some more fruit.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2006 Pours a hazy amber/honey colored liquid with a big white foamy and fully lasting head.
Aroma is hoppy, with citrusy character and notes of dark tea, anise, grapes, grapefruit, pine spruce and other herbs very difficult to decipher. Some floral hints too. Really complex and beautiful smell.
Flavor is also very hoppy, very bitter for an ESB. Strong bitter lemon touches with  a supercharged Royal Ceylon tea touch. It feels great.
Texture is a little light, like heavy water. Medium bodied and with the alcohol well hidden. Nice astringent finish. Good and long aftertaste. Low carbonation.
A delightful ESB.


Im really greatful with <a href=http://ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=5855& for this bottle. Thank you!
Shared with my buddies, <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-31163.htm >Lilith and <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-35128.htm  >nigredo

Bottle Looks like melted honey in the glass with a large off-white head. The aroma is faint, sweet with touches of Anis, vanilla, tropical fruits (mostly papaya and banana) and alcohol as in perfume smell. Flavor is overall sweet, malty very cereal-wise a bit hoppy and with a more bitter finish. Long aftertaste. Light to medium body, nicely carbonated.
<FONT SIZE=1>Thanks to <a href= http://ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=5855> Lubiere for this one </FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>Bottle shared with <a href = 

http://www.ratebeer.com/View-User-30044.htm&gt Panzerfaust 

and <a href = 

http://ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=35128& Nigredo  

</FONT>

Bottle.  Clear brown (copper) color, bubbles and nice beige head.  Hops, yeast and caramel aroma.  Taste is lightly malt and lightly bitter, grapefruit and watery texture but good palate.  

Bière de couleur brune clair avec des bulles dans sa robe et un bon collet beige.  Odeur de houblon, levure et caramel.  Goût assez discret de malt et une légère amertume, pamplemousse, texture acqueuse mais, elle est quand meme assez ronde en bouche.

Bottle, RBSG 2005.

Head is mostly diminishing.
Body is medium amber.

Aroma is moderately malty (cookie), moderately hoppy (orange), with a note of tobacco.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Pleasant, if unexciting.

Bottle shared with and courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a cloudy orange-gold with a large lasting foamy white head. Aroma of sweet malt, fruit, spices and cedar-like hops -- quite original. The flavour was quite unexpected, its delicious and even more original! Floral hops, wood, spices, cedar again and fruit. Creamy mouthfeel and medium bodied. What an interesting and very enjoyable take on an ESB!

Bottle (500ml).  Shared with blankboy, my bottle, via trade with turg.  Poured cloudy orange-amber with a large lasting foamy-creamy head.  Almost juniper/cedary (spicy?) aroma of funky UK hops, some malt,yeast - nice!  Taste, wow, thats unexpected: cedar? juniper?  whatever it is, its sharp, pungent, dry, floral - hoppy, but not any hops Ive ever had.  Man I like this.  Mouthfeel is creamy, average body, very astringent, lightly carbonated - this is a fantastic and unique brew.  Thanks a ton, turg!!!
Another great product from Chralevoix brewery. The bitter taste has a good feeling in your mouth as it goes down, and an after taste that is very pleasant.

Bottled provided to me by Martin, served in a standard English pint glass: Unflitered hazed light copper hue with a large frothy head and very nice lace. The aroma is classic Bitter, aromatic (EKG?) and fresh herbal hops, mild fruity apple and orange esters, dusty yeast, and biscuity malt.  The taste is a mostly smooth sweet malt based with a dash of citric bitterness. I am getting more of a Contentinal hop bill on the palate than British. The finish is surprising juicy and astengent with some corriander spice notes, much more than most ESB I am used too. Like other have stated seems a like cross bred APA/Pils/ESB combination. The feel is slightly sharp and lively with a mettalic finish. Overall a good brew and a bit different from the genre.
Bu avec ma mère. Arome intéressant, légé. Goût pas trop amère, épicé et fruité Pas mauvais ça!

500 ml bottle. Amber color. A bit cloudy towards the end. A small foam head leaving good lace. The aroma is floral, clove or citrus possibly  spices and coriander. Flavour of grapefruit and some bitterness in the finish. Not my style of beer but I recognize that it could be very  interesting if you like this type.

Bouteille-Couleur cuivre avec odeur de blé et de houblon. Mince mousse crèmeuse. Goût subtil annexant céréale, fruits, houblon et malte. Interessant.--Bottle-Copper with a wheat and hops aromas. Thin creamy head Subtil taste of cereal, fruits, hops and malt. Interesting.
500 ml bottle.  Amber color.  A bit cloudy.  Really small foam head.  It got a weird bitter after taste.  Doesnt taste like the IPAs Im used to.

1/2 liter bottle ( thanks Francois) puts a lush, clouded orange colored ale in my glass ,reminiscent of liquid buck wheat honey. A medium pour staks the glass with an enormous frothy- sticky light tan cap which lingers to the end of the drink. Fantastic lacing! 

Light aromas of musty fruit and honey with a grassy hop tone. Medium bodied, silky mouth feel. The tastes are husky cramel-malts up front which battles with the palate for dominance with ample piney resinous hops. Mid drink the hops win and take over as a dominent bittering floods the finish . A very substantial and satifying ESB.

[500ml bottle, 2 months old, 12 c]

Clear to opalescent amber color. Nice rocky off-white head. Aroma is medium malty, yeasty/some banana esters, herbal hoppy Being malty, taste is typical to bottled ESB. Heavy hop in the development. A little dry finish. Another wonderful beer made in Quebec!
sucré avec des notes florales mais avec un post-goût assez "bitter". Même si ce nest pas vraiement mon genre de bière je reconnais quelle est assez intéressante.

Bottle aged 6+ mo. 500ml bottle. Served at 58­°/14.5°C in my Duvel tulip. Pours milky, copper brown with a huge, cream colored head. The aroma is earthy hops, spice, and a nice honeyish sweet malt backing. The taste is caramelly malt with some earthy hops flavor and moderate bitterness in the finish. There is a spicy, lingering aftertaste. More bitterness than a typical ESB, which I certainly enjoy. Almost more like an APA, in fact it reminds me of a more earthy, less citrus blvd pale ale. Thanks beerbuzzmontreal.

500 ml bottle.  Deep copper colour with a thick, creamy, persistant head.  Aroma is quite herbal, earthy and lightly spicy.  Quite an unusual dusty aroma in this one.  Flavour is quite malty and sweet, with caramel and toffee making an appearance among lots of biscuity malt flavour.  Some heavy earthy hops, a bit perfumy.  There is a slight astringency on the finish, that makes the beer seem less sweet than it otherwise might.  Full bodied.  Moderate to high bitterness for the style and a strong earthy hop flavour.  Thanks Turg.
[Bottled at the brewpub] An unclear orange beer with a small white head. The aroma is sweet hoppy with some notes of coriander. The flavor is sweet floral with a nice dry hoppy end.

Hazy amber w/ rocky off-white foam. Aroma of Fruity hops, bready malts & caramel w/ some phenols evident. Soft, medium feel. Moderately malty, moderately bitter flavour that is perhaps a bit stale. Earthy, somewhat tobacco-like finish.

(500ml bottle) Clear (though the bottom of the bottle pours hazy) amber body topped by a big off-white head.  On the pour, the roiling of the carbonation is beautiful.  Aroma is medium sweet, pine, light bready.  Taste is moderately sweet, bread, caramel, pine, pineapple.  Medium body, light sticky/resin.  A little more bitter than the style suggests, but I have never found that to be a deterrent.
Bottle.  Amber, yellow head.  An excellent example of a style that Im normlaly only so-so on.  Strongly malty, faint peppermint and pine needles.  Crisp, well-balanced finish.

bottle. hazy orange-copper body with a rich bready head. aroma is predominately yeast and citrus hops with orange rind notes. I like it -  its quite hoppy. Citrus flavour, yeasty mouthfeel, and some biscuit malts. lingering bitter finish. pleasantly surprised.
RBSG 05.  Aroma of Diacetly, fruit, and earthy.  Flavor is sweet with some herbal hoppy notes.  Finishes a bit sour and a little too dry.

500 ml bottle. Deep amber colour with a mostly lasting creamy and frothy off-white head. Slight haze. Caramel, floral\, and pine aroma with banana notes. Bready, caramel malts with banana esters sneaking in and a fresh piny bitter finish. Medium bodied, juicy and lightly sticky but very refreshing. Folle, indeed.

Hazy amber colour.  Fruity-hoppy aroma with a few phenols (often found in Quebecois bottled beers...grumble).  Very dusty, yeasty, fairly phenolic.  Slightly toasty.  Perhaps not at its freshest, but I was 50 feet from the brewery so what can I say?

Pour was honey colored amber with a thin off white head...smell is a little floral, but mostly sweet bread dough malt...taste was the exact opposite...very dry and bitter...some butter in the finish...

Bottle: Poured an hazy amber color ale with a bit foamy head with better then average retention. Aroma of floral hops and big malt is easily noticeable. Taste is bigger and stronger then your average English bitter with some lots bitter hops and a full body. Does not stay within the style limit but is very enjoyable nonetheless.

More than just a palate cleaner, with orange colour and retaining head. Yeastiness, lace, aroma. The bitterness is moderated by the yeast, apple there, and malts. Appropriately and strongly carbonated.Good outside in the heat. Cross style, or defies style.

This pours burnt orange w/ a huge dirty white head. 
The flavor is slightly sweet & malty up front with a dry finish. Its an easy drinking brew.

Hazy reddish-amber color, with a rocky tan-colored head leaving good lace, hop flower, fruity note of grapefruit, caramelized malt and floral aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate, with a fruity note, malted caramel, hoppy and leafy accent, bitterness touch, toasty malt in a bitter hop finish.

Bottle: Cloudy caramel, somewhat dark, gigantic rocky off-white head, copious amounts of carbonation, sticky lacing.   Pale hoppy aroma, somewhat earthy, slightly musty.   Spritzy mouthfeel *burp*, hop bitterness is apparent yet not overly stated.   Slight graininess, moreso earthy/musty.   Moderate body, lingering musty hop bitterness and slighlty fruity at the finish.   A bit bigger than your average ESB, different, but fairly tasty.   Thanks Jeff!

Bottle. Picked up during Blevins bachelor party in Montreal. Clear dark amber ody witha  big fluffy white head. Some earthy hops in the aroma, glimpse of alcohol. Hint of citrus. Flavour is fairly citrusy for an Englihs ale, but I like it. Nice malty support, but the hops are the focus. Lingering citrus - grapfruit. Citrus is moderate throughout but noticable.  Nice understated caramel malt. Average appropriate body.  Nice beer.

2005 bottle, thanks Martin!  Pours a deep brown-raspberry-orange color, lightly hazy, unfiltered, with a massive amount of lasting, yellow-tinged white head.  Aroma has notes of dry wood, lightly spicy hops, light Belgian yeast notes and hints of caramel, raspberries and orange marmalade.   I personally thought it started with a Belgian-like yeast flavor, much like a Belgian Ambrée ale, but then some spicy hops, English in nature enter the mix, while a lightly dry toffee and caramel mix with hints of toasted grains.  Flavor is full and the malt extraction is well-done here.  It is hard to ask for a much more pleasing mouthfeel.  Lightly creamy, low, natural carbonation and a medium to medium-full body without comprimising drinkability.  Bitterness comes in the middle and lingers lightly on the end, just enough there to add complexity, without going overboard/out-of-style.  As it warms, the flavor thins out somewhat on the end, and there is a little bit too much dry breadiness on the end, but its hardly a significant fault.  Zesty hops, oranges, pears and apples, with light caramel malt linger on.  This brewery kicks ass!

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2005 Superbe robe orangée aux reflets rougeâtres légèrement voilée surmontée dune mousse-éponge à la dentelle très fine. Arômes de houbon poivré, de fines herbes, de levure et de zestes dorange amère. Saveurs dagrumes, de pêches et de fruits des champs. Très beau mariage de houblon amérisant et aromatique. Forte présence du malt.

Thanks to MartinT for getting this for us! Fresh hop nose with an odd plastic smell, hazy ruby-orange color, sticky frothy head. Creamy grainy malt with a hint of orange gives way quickly to a gritty bitter hop, somewhat like cardboard. Now, I like really really bitter beers, but this isnt a good bitter, in my opinion.

Many thanks to MartinT for this nice present to pivo,  he is a good husband and shared it with me :-) Nice deep orange color, medium frothy head. Youwza what a yummie aroma grabbed my nose: apricot, yeast, also koriander and cobbwebs. Intense grapefruit and slightly apricot taste, medium lasting. In the middle mustard seeds. Kind of agressive the more you drink in the bitterness. I liked the label with the "stoned cow", jumping over a fence while wearing a bucket on the head.

beautiful looking beer.  hazy copper with a huge pillowy off white head.  aroma has hay, yeast, citrus, leaves, toasted bread and caramel.  fine beaded carbonation.  lots of fresh orange and grapefruit in the flavour with an underlying earthy bitterness.  very tasty.  thanks martin

Bottle... Hazy, copper ale with a monstrous, creamy, vanilla head. Good retention with good, cumulus lacing. The aroma is of yeast, clove and iced tea. I suspect goldings hops, though I have been wrong before. The flavor is mild and in-line with the style except for a yeasty, spicy note. Well-balanced. Light to medium-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, crisp, lightly bitter finish.
Malty nose with some hops as well, copper, with a small tan head. Taste is malty, with a fruity aftertaste(peach?) Well balanced, woody bitterness,  very nice offering. Thanks Radek.
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2004 Bottled. Copper colour, rich lasting head. Flowery nose. Sweet and bready with lots of caramel. Soft and very malty with somewhat syrupy mouthfeel. Salty finish.

(500 ml bottle).  Creamy light brown tan head, fully lasting, fair to good lacing.  Hazy (not clear) amber orange body.  Moderate to high hops aroma (floral, citrus). Bread aroma with tones of burnt and lighly nutty.  In my mouth, first light sweetness with moderate floral hop flavor as well as a bit nutty and burnt flavor.  Later on, moderated to high hop bitterness of average to long duration, very pleasing.  Light to medium body, lively carbonation.  I was quite surprise by the result.  A special ESB.

(500ml bottle) I only had the chance to pour the initial 100ml from the bottle before the head quickly stretched out to reach the rim of the glass. That was one quick head that I have only ever witnessed on a Belgian prior to this event. It was like a depth-charge reaching for the sky! The head settles as a lofty 2in frothy beige foam and the body beneath is an orangey-copper. The nose is somewhat spiced and tinny with strong undertones of roast malts. The flavour however displays great balance with the hops knocking the front of the mouth and the maltiness settling at the rear - a very mellowing taste with some West Coast Hoppers finishing across the taste buds. Very enjoyable though I should have sampled it when it was fresher... I guess that is something I can look forward to!
Real good beer. Nicely bitter with nutty and caramel notes. Real citrus aromas. Always have to have one when I go to the Pub.
Nice bitter , hop-malt accented ale  . Medium bodied , pleasantly bittered , and clean .
Pours a hazy brown with a huge head.  Some yeast particles. Aromas of citrus, a bit of caramel and hops. Citrus malt and hops taste. Decent hop bitterness to finish. Medium body.

Grapefruit in the nose with vinous notes as well.  Almost has a little barleywine character.  Amber/garnet ruby color thats mildly hazy with a robust light tan head and nice lacing.  Pretty stuff.  Wow, this is some nice stuff.  This has a very very good balance of malts and hops.  Finishes with a classic bitter finish. Hints of smoke in the finish as well.  Grapefruit at the end as well.  Some sweetish toasted malts to start.  Very creamy and full-bodied stuff.  thanks rastacouere!

Monstrous head that settles quite quickly leaving smaller islands of lace. Hazy bespeckled amber liquid. Mild orange and lime, dry malt and caramel, light cherry and cream aromas. Nothing overpowering, just quite a bit going on in the nose. Lilting across the palate. Flavors are quite mild. Lightly fruity and backdrop of malt. Touch of acidity keeps things lively. Finish is both malty and bitter. Slightly toasted nuts with a fruit glaze. Very enjoyable quaff. Thanks Ratacouere.

Mahogany with a huge frothy head, and spotty lacing. Floaties! Big time grapefruit in the nose. Small hops. Floral and citrus. Flavor contains a nice malt profile. The grapefruit comes in first and last though. Sharp palate, slightly acidic, medium body and bitter spice finish. Nice.

Particle ridden hazy brown/ruby with thick head & light lacing. The aroma is like pure grapefruit juice & light caramel malt. The flavor is citrusy with tangy grapefruity hops & a light hop sweet balance. Overall this is a good esb, different from what Im use too. Good though!

A vibrant orange ESB, with loads of citrus fruit and bitter aromas.  Both the fruit and hops flavors are quite intense, but the balance and integration between the two flavors is remarkable. Smooth mouth-feel and lots of sediment. Tastes fresh almost like a homebrew. Well worth trying. Thanks Lubiere!

Cloudy orange in colour with lots of sediment.  Aroma was caramel, fruit(apples, pears), some yeast, and citrusy hops.  Flavour was of moderate bitterness, slightly sweet, lots of fruit including citrus.  Medium body, smooth-creamy mouthfeel.  Finishes slightly bitter, long.  Definitely British.  Good stuff.

500ml bottle.  A hazy, orange ale capped by a well-formed, fully-lasting head that leaves good lacing.  Light aroma of caramel, fruit (pears, cherries), and leafy, citrusy hops.  Light body with a firm, minerally mouthfeel and moderate carbonation.  Fruity flavour with some juicy acidity up front, and a crisp, citrusy hop character that reveals itself at the finish.  As a session bitter, it works fairly well.  But its lacking the fuller body and flavour of a good ESB.

500 ml bottle.  Clear salmon, fizzy-foamy fast-decaying head.  Piney hops, fruit (cherries, apricots), and some neat funky stuff in the nose...quite inviting.  Alas the flavor is somewhat lacking...really theres almost nothing at the front, just a slight dry paperiness; near the finish it comes around a bit, and the body is nice and full, but theres just not a lot of interest in this decayed husk of flavor.  I know Im in the minority, but cant say Ive been much impressed with this brewery thus far:  competently made, surely, but none of them have had any oomph or fire.  Give me unbalanced, unreliable, messed-up but exciting anyday!

Huge dense cream head; hazy foxy-amber beer. Nose gives double cream, maybe touch of diacetyl, right kind of English hops  with fruity aromas (pear, lime,...) Creamy taste, like thick home-made ice cream, but with a British hop flavouring (sounds terrible, is quite OK!) Unfortunately, the flavour falls away quite quickly, leaving just the mouthfeel: thick, creamy, slightly slick without losing all its refreshing qualities. Above all, I have to disagree with a lot of other tasters about this beers style. Its taste is definitely British - they ought to take a good CAMRA tour of Britain. But what probably misleads them is the MOUTHFEEL, with its thick, pappy, filling roundness typically Belgian indeed. That doesnt make it a Belgian ale yet. Thanks, MartinT!

Large lasting fizzy white head and good lacing. Orange and slightly cloudy. Aroma of a good pale ale or IPA. Citrus and hoppy. A little spice in the flavour and a dissapointing finish. Orange and lemon flavours.

Amber color, thick but fugaceous head. Medium carbonation. A LOT of sediment in it. Grapefruit and floral hops aroma. Wow ! Amazing, huge, powerfull grapefruit flavor with some light acidity and sweetness. Very good beer, it reminds me of the Hophead IPA which was Cascade hops all the way.
Thanks to Lubiere. Orange in color. Lots of floaties. Ok beer. Fruity aroma. Malty. Hoppy. Cascades. Ok.
Thanks to Lubiere...Orange, tan head, floaties. fruity aroma with hints of cascades. Flavor is a nice balance of crystal malts, cascade flavor hops, and gentle bitterness. This is an ok US ESB.
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Hoppy aroma with some bitter orange. Large pillowy white head on on copper coloured body with a slight haze. Fruity esters initially (pear, orange, grape) with lots of hop flavour and a lasting sweetness in the finish with a good bitterness. Decent carbonation with medium body and a pleasant creamy mouthfeel. It's definitely not a traditional ESB - more of a belgian bitter perhaps, but definitely very enjoyable. Bottle.

Hazy amber beer with huge floaties. Once you get past the floaties, a wonderful aroma comes out, with a fruit salad containing kiwi, green grapes and citrus, with very floral hops. Wonderful hops dance in your mouth with that fruity feeling. Rather complex considering the stimuli I experienced. The citrus caracter become more and more present as the beer wamed up.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2011 Murky amber appearance with quite a few sediments, but not nearly as many as others it seems. Smallish light honey head. It displays a rather original nose for a bitter, almost belgian yeasty flavors (oranges, pears) accompanying the butterscotch malt profile and the subdued hops (citrus, lemon). Palate is fruity, lightly tart and proposing a dry and bitter finish. Not a traditional bitter thats for sure and possibly my favorite of the very few Ive had, but this still doesnt come close to rocking my boat, for the same refreshing and quaffable qualities, Id much rather have victorys prima pils from a few hours ago. I loved the coating round mouthfeel though. Nevertheless, this beer has given me the feeling that Charlevoixs domain remains belgian styles (although Im longing for their doppelbock) and thats for the best from my egoistical point of view!  Second batch which was delivered in Montreals neighborhood around late september 2004 impressed me more. Very quaffable with less expressive yeast character. Less citric and just more defined malt profile. I really dug this one. 7/4/8/4/15 = 3.8 ////  I had not had this beer in a couple of years. Now in 2004, Im still comfortable with my previous score, finding the pie crust maltiness fun, the appearance flawless and the citrusy hops lending a bit too far on the soapy side of things to be captivating. It remains a pleasurable drink with a fun yeast character, but perhaps a bit agressive with its tight small bubbles.

Very cloudy caramel body with plenty of yeast. Thin but quite dense head. Its spicy (ginger) and fruity (citrus) aroma could have more punch, but the taste (same thing as the aroma) is wonderful and strong. The alcohol is well hidden and the final is balanced. Interesting...

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 Nearly endless head over chestnuts and delicate caramel... Sweet flowers over peppery, earthy and resinous hop bitterness... A slender and balanced Premium Bitter and a highly competent go-getter...

UPDATED: APR 11, 2004 Dense body due to bottled-conditionned process??? Nice orange-amber color. Very citrus like flavor (grapefruit actually). Low carbonation and good bitterness. Small presence of malt. Alcohol makes a warm feeling but does not cut the bitterness. A good example of ESB.
